dns-suffix.description: This value is appended to the framework-name value to form the canonical DNS name for the Kubernetes components.

enable-dns.description: Set to true to enable Kubernetes local DNS services, allows pods to locate services by name.

enable-deployments.description: Enable deployment experimental feature, not ready for production use.

enable-daemonsets.description: Enable daemonset experimental feature, not ready for production use.

etcd-mesos-framework-name.description: Which etcd-mesos framework to rely on. Corresponds to the configured framework-name for an etcd-mesos framework. Set this to disabled to use a local etcd instance in the scheduler container.

framework-name.description: The framework name to register with Mesos.

kube-dns-domain.description: Domain used by pods for Kubernetes service lookup.

kube-dns-service-ip.description: Kubernetes DNS service portal IP address, should fall in service-cluster-ip-range network range.

kube-dns-replicas.description: The number of kube-dns pods that Kubernetes will spin up at deploy time.

kube-dns-nameservers.description: Comma-delimited list of host:ip entries that point to fallback nameservers. Only used if nameservers cannot be extracted from the slave's /etc/resolv.conf

service-cluster-ip-range.description: Kubernetes DNS service portal IP address, should fall in service-cluster-ip-range network range.

service-node-port-range.description: A port range to reserve for services with NodePort visibility. Example: '30000-32767'. Inclusive at both ends of the range.

scheduler-service-ip.description: Kubernetes-Mesos scheduler service portal IP address, should fall in service-cluster-ip-range network range.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each instance.

failover-timeout.description: The failover_timeout for Mesos in seconds. If a new Kubernetes scheduler instance has not re-registered with Mesos this long after a failover, Mesos will shut down all running pods. Requires checkpointing to be enabled.

apiserver-port.description: Read/write host port that the Kubernetes apiserver listens on.

apiserver-proxy-port.description: Read/write host port that the Kubernetes nginx proxy in front of the apiserver listens on.

apiserver-secure-port.description: The Kubernetes apiserver port from which to serve HTTPS with authentication and authorization.

scheduler-driver-port.description: Host port that the Kubernetes-Mesos scheduler driver listens on.

scheduler-port.description: Host port that the Kubernetes scheduler listens on.

controller-manager-port.description: Host port that the Kubernetes controller-manager listens on.

instances.description: Number of Kubernetes scheduler instances to run.

logging-verbosity.description: Increase this value to obtain more detailed log messages.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Kubernetes scheduler instance.

default-container-cpu-limit.description: CPU shared to allocate to a container in a pod which is not CPU limited.

default-container-mem-limit.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to a container in a pod which is not memory limited.

initial-executor-cpus.description: Initial CPU shares allocated for the executor container.

initial-executor-mem.description: Initial memory (MB) allocated for the executor container.

framework-roles.description: Mesos framework roles that the scheduler receives offers for. Currently only * and optionally one additional role are supported.

default-pod-roles.description: Roles that will be used to launch pods having no k8s.mesosphere.io/roles label.

uris.description: List of URIs that will be download and made available in the current working directory of the scheduler.

generate-task-discovery.description: Generate Mesos task discovery information to be used by systems like mesos-dns.

proxy-mode.description: Which proxy mode to use: 'userspace' (older) or 'iptables' (faster). If the iptables proxy is selected, regardless of how, but the system's kernel or iptables versions are insufficient, this always falls back to the userspace proxy.

pki.description: Kubernetes certificates and private key configuration.

apiserver-crt.description: Base64 encoded blob containing a x509 Certificate for HTTPS. (CA cert, if any, concatenated after server cert).

apiserver-key.description: Base64 encoded blob containing a x509 private key matching apiserver-crt.

root-ca-crt.description: Base64 encoded blob containing the root certificate authority that will be included in service account's token secret. This must be a valid PEM-encoded CA bundle.

service-accounts-key.description: Base64 encoded blob containing a PEM-encoded private RSA key used to sign service account tokens.

labels.description: Set of labels to be applied to the Kubernetes Marathon application instance.

resource-roles.description: comma seperated string of acceptable Mesos resource roles to consider when scheduling the Kubernetes Marathon container. Set to 'slave_public' to force running Kubernetes on a public slave.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.
